noun.description: An abnormally high body temperature, usually accompanied by shivering, headache, and in severe instances, delirium.
examples: I would take aspirin to help me with the pain and reduce the fever

verb.description: Bring about a high body temperature or a state of nervous excitement in (someone)
examples: a heart which sin has fevered

origin: Old English fēfor, from Latin febris; reinforced in Middle English by Old French fievre, also from febris.
